intro: Marrubium cephalanthum subsp. montanum, commonly known as mountain horehound, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its use in traditional herbal remedies. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in harsh environments make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
